author: Craigurrard
title: Rude receptionist at Covid-19 booster clinic
body:
We attended for a Covid-19 spring booster at Blackfriars Hospital. Vaccination team were pleasant, very efficient and professional.  
Unfortunately it was spoiled by a receptionist who signed my wife and I in. They were rude and seemed only interested in themselves. The assistant/nurse who took us through to the vaccination room acknowledged that we were not the only people they had been rude to.  
We filled in a complaint card and I just wanted to make sure that our observations did not go unnoticed! hence this posting.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Patient and helpful staff
body:
I have only just arrived in Lurgan a few days ago by ambulance. The ambulance took around an hour or so. I am not completely sure.  
Although I sometimes get confused the staff are always so helpful and patient, even if that does mean repeating themselves. Although Lurgan is very lovely I would just like to be in my own wee home making a cup of tea, but with the help from the nurses and physio I am hoping that won’t be too long away.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jibbers
title: It has been a fairly unpleasant experience both times
body:
I have had two cervical screenings at The Riverside Practice, both performed by the same nurse, and sadly it has been a fairly unpleasant experience both times. Unfortunately I don't know the name of this practice nurse.  
The first screening took place in 2019. It was my first cervical screening, so I was experiencing some nervousness. The nurse instructed me to get undressed and then left me laying naked from the waist down for a good five minutes, with nothing to cover me, while she did something on her computer. This made me feel very uncomfortable and exposed. When she got round to the procedure, her approach felt lacking in care. She did not talk me through the procedure at all (which I feel should always happen when such an intimate test is being carried out, let alone when it's the patient's first time), nor did she warn me when the speculum was going in. I found the whole experience cold and unfeeling.  
Unfortunately, three years later in 2022, my smear test was just the same. This time, I asked for something to cover me as I remembered what happened last time - and again nothing had been offered to me.  
The nurse did not talk me through the procedure, and in my opinion abruptly shoved the speculum inside me without warning and with what felt like minimal lubrication. The procedure itself was then very rough and somewhat painful, which it should not be. This made me feel really uncomfortable.  
When carrying out such an intimate procedure that many people feel nervous about, I feel medical professionals should be employing a kind, clear, consensual bedside manner. I think they should always let you know when they are about to touch you or insert something into you. In my opinion this nurse's bedside manner is, quite frankly, crap. It is reported that the uptake of smear tests is so low and I think this is why!  
If I was someone who was scared of getting my smear, this experience would put me off going back.  
Cervical screenings are so important to get, so I feel medical professionals need to remember that there is an actual human being on the end of the speculum - please!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: capellabn38
title: This place is security bonkers
body:
There are many locked doors. This place is security bonkers, with that there is protocol ways of going on. Which you do have to adhere to all this tends to have to one side my session. I suppose, what do you expect in a top security mental hospital.  
It's getting bad outside the gates as well. People question whether they are allowed to do things that I took for granted in the 50's 60's and 70's.  
It keeps moving more & more towards a police state. You have to have permission for everything.

author: Grizz
title: Long wait for discharge prescription
body:
I attended day surgery recently for a total hip replacement surgery procedure. The operation and aftercare was satisfactory and was very pleased with the care I received in the ward and theatre.  
I was passed fit to go home on the Friday, with slightly low blood pressure, but agreed with the nursing staff that it would be prudent to stay until Saturday morning.  
Saturday morning, around 09:00hrs, I was informed that I was able to go home and the pharmacy would get my prescription to me to take home with me. The staff nurse informed me that the pharmacy did not open until 10:30hrs on a Saturday and that it should only take around two hours. I waited and waited to the embarrassment of the nursing staff and my prescription arrived at 5pm. A six and a half hour wait in the ward.  
To cap it all, I assume no porters were available as the poor staff nurse had to wheel me, in a wheelchair, down to the car pick up point which seems such a shame as she appeared to be run off her feet in the ward. Must try harder I am afraid and the pharmacy department is singled out for my anger.

author: RIRuth
title: Hearing about the dates for isolation was helpful
body: Caller just sounded human. With guidance changing and all different regions in UK/ROI in news it was really confusing, so hearing about the dates for isolation was helpful

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Peaceful but also very boring.
body:
My time in Lurgan is peaceful but also very boring, I find it hard to get my day in by just watching TV.  
I get so fed up of doing the same things. It can be very repetitive watching the same shows and doing the same crosswords every day.  
I don’t have much time left in Lurgan as I will be getting out soon as I am feeling a lot better and definitely on the mend.  
Although the nurses have been fabulous for my time here and I am very appreciative, my daughter is a nurse and I think they deserve the biggest thank you as they work so so hard every day.  
The meal portions are great I am always left very full and satisfied.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Wyllow Wytch
title: Could not had had a better experience
body:
I had a hysteroscopy at D+G Royal Infirmary. I have terrible anxiety about going into hospital after having had a lot of major surgery over the years resulting in PTSD.  
The short stay ward staff were amazing. So helpful and understanding. My consultant was very caring and the anaesthetists also.  
I could not have had a better experience considering the difficulties I have just getting to the hospital.  
Thank you all so much.

title: Cervical screening
body:
Awful service

Booked an appointment to be told that I can’t have a cervical screening test as it’s not due, even though I’ve had abnormal bleeding for 5 months and then receive a text and letter the next day to say I can book an appointment

title: Specsavers provide good service
body: I have found Specsavers service is thorough and professional... They seem to have all the latest equipment and their staff are well trained and explain everything in understandable language.

title: Poor telephone service
body: Cannot get through on phone to ask about X-ray results and have been calling repeatedly every day but with no joy for two weeks. Visited the practice in person and was told the only way to access was through phoning. Endless loop! I  have no idea how someone who has additional needs accesses the service. Practice not listening to complaints and not addressing!

author: jackpotbn73
title: Dietician support is improving my diet, mental health and diabetes
body:
Having suffered from severe depression for years, my diet had got out of control. From being healthy prior to depression to being awful through it!  
Having been introduced to the dietician service through my GP, I worked with a dietician for approximately 6 months with appointments being frequent to begin with, and getting further apart over time. I was provided with fantastic support and input into decision making which helped so much.  
Small steps were required and initially the changes to my diet weren't about cutting out the poor food choices I had been making, but to add in positive choices.  
Initially I committed to eating one piece of fruit per day - a food group which hadn't even registered in the previous few years. Such a small step was really tough, but made easier by discussing what fruit would be easy. Apple, pears and bananas needed no preparation so started on those. I didn't eat fruit everyday to begin with but after a while started to go for fruit as a snack over prepared foods such as crisps or chocolate.  
Encouraged by this, other goals included reducing intake of certain food groups & drinks. Initially I reduced my intake of (sugar free) pop before removing it from my diet, replacing it with water or water with sugar free cordial. My bread intake had been nearing a loaf of bread daily. Working together we reduced that over time to 6 slices per day and have since reduced that to 4 slices per day.  
We looked at what a plate of food was to me and how it was composed, increasing the vegetable portion and slightly reducing the carbohydrate portion, although stressing to reduce this as it is key to a balanced diet, and not remove it! Then we reviewed portion size and I realised I was easily eating around 2 people's portions of a meal.  
I struggled to reduce this until it was suggested that after cooking but before eating I refrigerate half of the meal making it more difficult to go back for seconds. This easy solution had such an immediate impact. The strange thing was, I didn't feel more hungry even though I was eating around half what I previously had been.  
I hadn't eaten breakfast for years and that was the next thing we worked on. I now eat breakfast most days, not every day but I'm working on that still. I'm using pre-packaged porridge so I only have one serving - I found that my portion control was extremely poor when using normal porridge so conceded that using pre-packaged was necessary so I don't increase the portion size over time.  
Through this, I've found that my mental health is inextricably linked to my eating and although I have a way to go, not only have my blood sugar readings improved, but my mood has improved. I will have some improvements to make, but feel on the way to reversing my type 2 diabetes!

title: Excellent practice
body: Appointment was for 16.10, I was seen at 16.12, everywhere is spotless, my Partner has to Ipswich Eye clinic and she might have an appointment for 11 o’clock and sometimes we might be there until around 3 pm! I’m glad I go to Evolutio

title: Exceptional standard of care
body: Was admitted to the ROH with a fractured femur, All the staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for me. I could not find any negatives to say about this Hospital. Will be going back in April 2022 for an EPR- endoprosthesis of my left leg.

title: Good patient care
body: Over the past 2 years, although the practice has been extremely busy. Both the reception team and the Drs have provided very good care and attention and have been very supportive in my medical treatment.

author: ocean22
title: Positive visit to the oral & maxillofacial dept
body: The care was great. The staff were very kind and understanding and explained things easily.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb
body: From start to finish the care & treatment was amazing!! From the receptionist to the surgeons to the discharge nurse I could not be happier!

title: Good experience
body: I'm registered myself ,husband and baby. I recently went to the consultation and immunization for the baby, they were kind and they scheduled me when it suited me after the time, and when I went to the appointment I waited about 10 minutes until they received me. They responded to everything I was interested in and behaved nicely

title: Fabulous care, and great service
body: Once again the amazing staff helped us today from the first telephone call to reception (helpful, kind, brilliant) to the moment we left the surgery. Kind and caring from start to finish, thank you

title: Dont Even Bother. Just Call The Undertaker
body: Completely Useless. Computers are always the Excuse for the failure. This is not a Failure due to the Pandemic although this is one of many regular excuses. It is merely a lack of Knowledge and Experience on the part of the Staff. Double and Treble Booking is Commonplace Too Many Patients registered with the surgery. But this is much the same everywhere. Two weeks to get appointment for a simple B12 Injection.Place is a Joke

title: Can't get appointments
body: Terrible service. Line always engaged for hours, can't get appointments. Try e-consult and made an appointment for over a week later, then on the day they phoned to say the doctor was sick. Made another e-consult appointment and currently being ignored. I desperately need a blood test and I can't get one.

title: None caring
body: They made my 17year old daughter go into A&E herself, she kept on calling me to ask me what she needed to do. After waiting outside for her, she came out still unsure what the problem was with her knee and toe. They just said to her you can go home now and because I wasn’t with her to ask questions she forgot

title: Supportive and proactive
body: The doctors here really listen, talks through your needs and ensure any follow up takes place. Definitely recommend.

title: Great practice
body: All were very friendly and helpful. I especially loved how the Dr really took her time to explain my condition and the treatment option available. I had great visits every time. Doctor's kindness and demeanor and the Nurse practitioner was very approachable has really put me at ease so I highly recommend this clinic.

title: Really excellent practice
body: After a phone conversation with one of the doctors I booked a follow up face to face appointment this week. The doctor was extremely thorough and listened to my present condition and family history carefully. I was then offered follow up tests for the following week, after the Doctor gave considerable thought to what I needed next. Really well managed GP with two excellent consultations. Thank you.

title: Unsatisfactory
body: Couldn't get medication which had supposedly been put through to the dispensary but hadn't. Unable to book an appointment and unable to do e-consultancy. Basically very bad for a doctors surgery, no wonder hospitals are over run with patients. Ailments don't go away because you cannot contact a doctor.

title: Amazing caring GP’s
body: This practice is my elderly parents surgery.  Over the last 3 years I’ve had to use the frequently regarding both my parents I’ll health.  I have to say this is an amazing practice and I wish it was mine.  The Gp’s, reception, nurses and staff  go above and beyond to help in some very complicated situations.  Their repeat prescription line is so easy to use. Having a great surgery support me makes my life easier when caring for my parents. They take an interest and I feel they know my parents well both medically and personally. Keep up the good work!!!

title: Excellent communication and efficiency
body: After speaking to various members of staff I have nothing but praise for all the team at this Practice. They dealt with my issue promptly and sensitively. Thank you to all and keep up the wonderful work.

title: A&E    second to none
body:
The waiting time was less than 1 hr - on Sat. afternoon!    The staff superb.   Scan within 3 hrs.    Surgeon really took time to review scan.   Pain relief as and when asked for.     I come from Ipswich, Suffolk and compared to that hospital - well there is no comparison.
Congratulations, well done and thank you to all the staff at A&E.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I cannot fault this practice.  All of the staff are friendly and very helpful. I've had a challenging couple of months health wise, and the support has been second to none.  Even through the height of the pandemic, they rose to the challenge and provided the best service that it was possible to give. 
Keep up the excellent work, it does get noticed.

title: Accident and Emergency     Good experience
body: Was admitted via ambulance a week ago with severe chest pains. Ambulance staff were so good and when I arrived staff were informed and reassuring.Explained at each step what was happening. All staff I met during my 12 hour admission were clear and calm in their approach and I felt very safe in their hands. The relationship between all staff seemed respectful and good and I observed great courtesy between them even when there were crisis situations and pressure.They were very aware of the stress for relatives who had to wait outside because of covid and they gave them as clear a plan as they could of when they would be updated or able to see their loved one.I was discharge after being monitored and tested, with a follow up plan. On shift handover the senior nurse went round and thanked as many individuals on her shift for their support and at the end an announcement saying similar was made before the handover. The next shift were fully informed of my situation and seamlessly picked up with my journey of care. I could not fault the care received during this admission.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb experience
body: Went to endoscopy and ct scan….staff where extremely professional…seen both times on time..could not fault the experience and care given…thank you

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Agreed great practice
body:
Made the procedure very clear, and making arrangements immediately. I feel very confident , and knowi
 I’m in good hands.

title: Great service
body: Very professional and supportive service, highly recommend, they took their time and answered all questions

title: Great service
body: Friendly and polite staff explained fully took time to answer questions I was not rushed good experience

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have no problems and am very happy with the care
body:
I had fallen at my house and was taken in. I have been moved 3 or 4 times until I have been settled in Female Medical. I have no problems and am very happy with the care I am receiving. I hope I do not cause too much bother to the staff working. The place is spotless and since I was last in there has been lots of improvements.  
The staff are very good, there is no trouble with them I have to give them credit for what they are doing, and they are excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: they went above and beyond for me
body:
I went to DAU for a scan and then waited to be told that I had to be admitted.  
The staff in DAU were lovely they went above and beyond for me, they definitely do not get paid enough for what they do.  
I was taken up to female medical this ward is very busy it never stopped. The cleanliness of the ward is something to be admired.  
The staff here are lovely and they definitely have some patience to be dealing with the likes of us every day for 12hours.  
Nothing to be improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: thank you to all the staff
body: I would like to say a big thank you to all the staff in ward 3 as they are looking after me very well! I am in lurgan for physio on my hip and I can definitely see a big improvement. The physio sessions keep me so motivated and help me to stay on track it also makes me feel great to know I could be going home very soon. The cleanliness on ward 3 is just great. The food has been lovely, tonight’s dinner was absolutely great and I also had room for some desert.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: i am in great hands
body: The food has been very nice, there is a lot of variety on the menu which is always great. The staff are so kind and thoughtful, they are always checking in to ask if there is anything I need. I am very comfortable here in lurgan. I know that the nurses will definitely help me to get better and that I am in great hands

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Left Disappointed
body: After being called by a friend who told me he was blacking out, I went to his home picked him up and took him to King George's Hospital around 7.00pm and it's now 1.20am and he's still waiting to be seen. It seriously doesn't appear that a service fir for purpose is being delivered to the A & E patients. The question doesn't seem to be moving, so the whole question going to triage are all sitting on the floor. There is a security guard who has been barking at the two security guards at the door, not to allow anyone to stand bear the entrance. Very unprofessional, people who are sick do not deserve to be treated so harshly. As a tax payer, this is not we have signed up for.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: So quick my eyes watered ??
body: I only had my eye test yesterday. I was not expecting to hear from anyone so quickly. very impressive service. I hope I don't have to wait too long for an appointment and treatment at the hospital

title: Great practice
body:
Not getting a parking ticket this time.
Very efficient service and the staff are lovely. I’d highly recommend Evolutio.

title: Worst gp ever
body:
If you manage to make an appointment very lucky. They tell u to ring at 800 and then leave you on hold for more than 40mins!!!! 
They obs no app the all day!!!

title: Horrible Experience
body: I went in with broken toes in my right foot around 21.00. Was triaged and told to wait until the doctor will see me. I was called after 6hours at 3.20 am in the morning and told by a nurse that there's still long wait to see a doctor, but she couldn't give the estimate. Then she said that wether toes are broken or not they wouldn't do anything anyway apart from strapping them together. So I asked her if she could do it... And guess what she told me after I was waiting there for 6hours in pain: "you're a big boy do it yourself". I left this Monty python'esque place and thought to myself I could have stayed home with ice on my foot instead of letting it to deteriorate in Southend A&E. Horrible experience, if i was told by the first nurse in triage that they won't do anything I would have left and saved time, and wouldn't have to listen to patronising nurse who did everything to encourage me to leave- no professionalism or compassion whatsoever.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Absolutely appalling service
body: The receptionist says you need to ring at 8am which I did either they say their busy and ring back ,or they keep you on hold .I have been on hold from 8am and know it is 8.45 and I am on hold yet and all there saying is thank you for holding you are 2 in the queue and when they do eventually pick up most likely they will say no appointments left .At 9-10 they say that sorry we are experiencing some difficulty and ring later .Absolutely disgraceful service

title: Thank You
body:
Thank you to the cardiology team who looked after me on the14th April 2022 who were kind, good natured and efficient which for me,  a scary experience was made less scary.
Vincent J Thompson

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great support
body: Had a four night stay in hospital, could not thank the staff and team on level 11, absolute amazing care and kindness.

title: And I thought that a Prostate Biopsy would be…
body:
Such an easy procedure and nowhere near as painful and nasty as you're led to believe it'll be. 
Staff all so very attentive, sociable, laid back and very professional. 
Worst part?  Having a freezing anasthetic sprayed on me "down there!"
Of course there's paperwork and vetting to be done but then its into a room all complete with couch and leg stirrups. Undignified yes but well organised and relaxed.  If you can get past the rather nasty feeling of someone poking around in a private area of your body then its easy.  Even the procedure itself isn't very painful - there's just a kind of shockwave that passes through you with every sample taken.
Time passed quickly and before long I was up, getting dressed and being offered a nice cuppa.  Must have a wee before you leave - not easy when you're not totally relaxed though!
And now fingers crossed for a good outcome.  The staff made everything so easy that I'd gladly go through that again if I had to.
A big thank you to the Urology team.

title: Disheartened
body: Following near two months with a condition called sciatica, I managed to make an appointment to see a physio at the surgery. My understanding of physio to support recovery & aim to avoid future recurrence was quite different to what I actually experienced here. The young physiotherapist had access to my medical records without my consent, which I feel guided his approach. It seemed that, as long as I avoid pooping in the bed & can hobble around, I'm not to return for further 'physio'. I left feeling so so disappointed. I hope the surgery can digest this review too but I'd have no interest in hearing from them on this matter.

title: Immediate care and concern after registering
body:
I was worried,  over 80 and had been very happy with my previous practice but had change due to house move. I feel so pleased at the way I have been received. The start is always the reception desk!!! Lovely every one of the three on duty!!! I have been satisfied with the response I received reference 2 "tricky" issues.I am now going to feel very positive in the future.
Many thanks.

title: Ridiculous wait time
body: Rang on 14th April and was told a doctor or receptionist would be back in touch by end of the day. Received nothing so I rang on 15th and have far spent over two hours on hold and no I'm not exaggerating. The first call lasted for 54 minutes with the music and automated voice so I hung up, rang back straight away and spent 1 hour and 17 minutes on hold with music and automated voice and ringing so I hung up and I am now on my third call. The reason I hung up both times is because two weeks ago when I rang I spent half an hour on the ringing part, hung up and rang back and got through straight. Whether you have a large amount of phones or small, having people waiting for over 2 hours and still not answering is not acceptable for a doctors practice, not everyone has a lot of minutes or credit and being on hold this long would eat through that.

title: To small and not very good for wheelchair users
body: It was not really good service especially for me and I am dreading going again I am in a wheelchair and I had to get out of it because the place was so small so I could not use my chair and the situation for me was totally unexceptionable it was a very horrible experience and I don’t really want to go again I find that Specsavers have more better experience with people like me than they do I felt very bad about the whole thing and I am dreading going again in 6 months time that’s all

title: Very unhelpful
body: I called for an urgent prescription for my son, was told no doctor available today, I was offered an appointment 10 days later, there is an extremely long wait before someone answers your call - I have spent over 45 minutes on 3 occasions this week! Its absolutely ridiculous. The new system of telephone calls is failing a lot of patients

title: Shambolic and poor
body:
Day surgery was nightmarish with unit unstaffed. Eventuality relocated and had procedure which I believe lasted signs 3 hours. 2 hours after waking I was shown to the top of the stairs and left to navigate my way outside. The surgery I had is known to cause dizziness. I was given no care instructions despite asking. 
Post op infection led to 4 courses of antibiotics. 
Follow up in clinic failed as, after waiting two hours, I was told that actually the surgeon is on leave. And I still don't know exactly what the surgeon did!
Dreadful place. Zero confidence in them being able to organise anything whatsoever with safety.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not all bad in these unprecedented times:
body:
Yes t has been a nightmare, at times, throughout the pandemic to get through to the practice, I have experienced, a number of times, what others have said in their reviews especially regarding being held in a lengthy queue (No.17) and then being cut off when got to No.1 - extremely frustrating. Things seem to have improved significantly since the new phone system has been operational. Yes, there have also been times when I have felt the need to complain over the past couple of years however I must say my complaints were dealt with professionally and every effort was made to resolve my concerns.
When I have got through to the 'right people' I am happy with my current treatment. I have used the surgery recently for myself and my mother which involved communication with receptionists, a nurse and a GP. To be honest I was expecting a lot of stress and anxiety trying to get appointments as I have experienced this in the past however all communication was far more positive than I expected from the onset. No long wait on the phone trying to get through, chirpy receptionist who was extremely helpful, as was the ones I dealt with when at the practice. The nurse was brilliant with my Mum who is deaf, and the GP I saw actively listened to what I said and followed up with a referral. So, all good and credit where it is due.
I want to acknowledge the difficulties that all NHS services have had to endure throughout the pandemic, also the frustrations that ALL staff have undoubtedly had to put up with, having said that there are some staff at APS  that really would benefit from additional training in customer service, I think it is such a shame if a service receives an overall bad reputation due to the few that let it down. I have been with this practice for 51 years now and as frustrating as things have got for me at times, I am still there. Thank you to those staff who continue to do their very best - You know who you are :-)

title: Fantastic service
body: Called 111 for a hand injury and referred to A&E. Was seen quickly and referred to the fracture clinic again seen quickly. Had an X-ray and back to fracture clinic and received treatment. In and out within an hour. Couldn't fault the staff in any way.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: App was 11am
body:
My appointment was 11 am at Tatu it is now 2.06 still not seen the Dr I realise its good friday but 3hrs!!!!!!absolutely dreadful no one tells you what's going on and I had to drive 45 mins to get here!!
Never again I'll find somewhere else]

title: great practice great staff
body: went yesterday to Preston, staff were the best i ever encountered.everyone there was friendly and helpful, the surgeon was also great, would recommend to all,

title: Awesome Care
body: From being referred to Mermaid Centre last Sept until now April 2022 l have received first class treatment. No body wants to be ill but thank goodness there are places like this. The Mermaid Centre, Sunrise & Headland Centres have saved my life. It’s been a tough time and l can’t thank them enough for what they have done, they take it in their stride but to someone diagnosed it’s so scary but with their help taking you through step by step you are able to cope and come through things the other end. The treatment from day one has been excellent l can’t fault them on anything. Thank you all.

title: Satisfied with my treatment
body: Face to face with the doctor and he took yime to explain his view on my symptoms fully and he offered ne a referral which accepted with thanks although I'm still waiting for a response firm the hospital

title: Absolutely awful surgery
body:
I have a permanent ileostomy requiring me to wear stoma bags daily. The company who j get these from have to each 4-6 weeks send the prescription to the surgery for it to be approved. The company sent the most recent request to them on 23/03 whilst I was in hospital having just had further surgery. They didn’t get round to authorising it until 04/04 and then decided they weren’t going to authorise two of the items I need! This then Held up the whole order.
This surgery is absolutely awful. The phone systems are not fit for purpose, as are some of their rude reception staff

title: Disgraceful
body: My 80 yr old mother was taken to hospital via ambulance with a serious UTI. Was kept waiting in the back of the ambulance in the hospital car park for 12 hours. Fortunately the paramedics were great to her even staying on after their shift had finished so they could wait with her. All said they were leaving the job because of the lack of care shown to patients at the hospital. After 12hrs was taken into A&E only to be put on a bed in a corridor for another 4 hours while waiting to be admitted to ward. Once in the ward the patient in the bed next to my mother said that her bed and one other in the room had been free for 24hrs. Who is coordinating care here?! This is completely unacceptable. The hospital isn’t fit for purpose.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Stravaig
title: Wonderful care at Glasgow dental hospital minor ops
body:
I had to get a lip biopsy and a gum biopsy. The staff were friendly and reassuring - they answered the many questions I had happily and overall made it as pleasant experience as it could be.  
One minor factor which would have helped would be if they had dark glasses instead of the clear ones which meant I had to keep my eyes closed. For me, closed eyes meant I had to focus a bit more on the sensations of the procedure and made it a little more overwhelming than it needed to be.  
Not a massive deal but just a wee pointer that something pretty minor can have a big effect on the overall experience.

author: Dorothy1953
title: Life in the pandemic
body: Life was difficult. As with many people I just ate my way through it. I comfort eat. Missed my crafting classes and friends.

author: jongi
title: Thank you for your lovely caring manner
body:
I wanted to write and say thank you for the experience I had in the Dermatology Department of the Victoria Hospital.  
Firstly my consultation with Rachel followed by care from Elaine and Kate who did my procedure made me feel at ease with their friendly and professional manner.  
I can't thank them enough for their lovely caring manner. We are very lucky in Glasgow to have such a wonderful NHS.  
Thanks again girls you are all truly amazing.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff listen to you
body:
I was transferred yesterday evening from Craigavon Area Hospital. I really did not feel like I was getting the care I needed there.  
Here in Daisy Hill on Female Medical I have to say although I have been here a short time it is very good and the breakfast is 100 times better here than CAH. The pure orange and milk carton was something I was not expecting.  
The ward is tidy and clean. The noisy bleeping of machines is something that cannot be helped at night but also to be expected since I am in hospital not a hotel.  
The staff are lovely a great bunch of people who listen to what you have to say.  
I would not say I have anything I would like changed here at this moment in time.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Williams0
title: Amazing care for robotic hysterectomy
body:
Admitted into DIU before operation staff were tremendous.  
Dr Fagen the consultant surgeon was amazing, along with all theatre staff. They made me so at ease.  
After the operation I was admitted to ward 54 where all the staff were brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble.

author: Mollydolly
title: Wonderful care as outpatient and inpatient
body:
I have had heavy menstrual bleeding for the last 5 years due to a fibroid resulting in anaemia.  
I was referred to Gynae Team at SWAH in Enniskillen last year, had a scan and hysteroscopy in October and an abdominal hysterectomy in March 2022.  
I cannot say how wonderful the care was both as an outpatient and inpatient in SWAH. Words cannot express my gratitude.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kathycornflakes2
title: My journey through melanoma treatment
body:
During lockdown April 2021 I noticed a freckle which I took a photo of and thought I must keep an eye on that! However nobody wanted to go to Dr at that time. In my total ignorance I wasn’t too worried as I believed skin cancer could just be removed from where it was, I had no knowledge of how melanoma could spread through the lymphatic and blood system. Perhaps that should be publicised more.  
A year later when I rang my doctor with a photo, she saw me two days later and within less than a week I was at dermatology in Barnstaple for a first appointment, then within a week the nurse was removing it plus surrounding area and sending it off for biopsy. Wow amazing speed of treatment.  
It’s the waiting that seems worse in any cancer investigation, but I was also lucky to have the result sooner than the maximum time predicted. Worryingly it was found to be a stage 2a melanoma, 3.3 ml deep. The cancer nurse who gave me the news was at all times compassionate and professional, answering my questions. At a time when it was not allowed to bring a family member to a consultation, my husband was permitted to be there, which made me realise just how serious it was.  
I can understand that nobody knows how their cancer journey may end, and many people would like to leave it that way. My nurse gave me information booklets and websites to gain information. I would always prefer to be told what the next steps are. Especially as the nurses are always there to support and I never felt left alone. Thank you.Then followed the trip to Exeter to see a consultant and the predicted delays because of covid. Not that we could really have afforded nor had any idea of the cost we had contemplated going private just to ‘jump the queue’ but were told it would be no quicker, with the consultant working all hours and out of hours on private patients. So we kept our faith with the NHS. Thankful that we did. I received an appt within four weeks to have a wider local excision a skin graft and lymph node removal.During several visits to Exeter, I received dressing care , the wound looking worse than I had imagined. Then came the next long wait to thankfully hear that the cancer had all been removed and none found in lymph nodes.  
Again I thought the wait was terrible and after the minimum time I rang Exeter for results. I do believe that had I not rung I may have had to wait till my consultant was back from holiday but as I was found to be all clear I was able to go to Exeter to be given the good news from a locum.  
I can understand how some people prefer not to tell their immediate family as they are the ones who can do nothing but worry and ask you how you are and make you feel like you are reliving each stage.  
The positives were the compassion and professionalism of Barnstaple dermatology, the nurse who did the initial surgery, and the cancer specialists, both Nurses and Doctor. They now follow up with a full body check every three months, you forget how embarrassed you feel but being a woman who has had children that goes with the territory!  
During Covid and lockdown, I had several short waits between procedures and waiting for results, I feel very lucky, considering the waits for surgery and appointments that others have had to endure.  
A big negative is the travelling from north Devon to Exeter for so many visits, accentuating just how remote Barnstaple hospital is. I believe it is the most remote hospital in UK.  
I had to leave home on the day of my surgery at 6.30 am to check in for 8am. I was told I would have surgery at 11am. At 3pm I was still waiting, nobody had given me any information about updated times. My elderly, diabetic husband was walking the streets of Exeter rather than drive home to return later. Eventually I was discharged at 7.30 pm. It would be good to think that day surgery could prioritise those who have to travel furthest and how they get there, but I can’t really complain when I hear of those who get ready for surgery only to be bumped.  
My GP had told me how much they would cut around the original freckle yet I was shocked when I first saw it after the WLE. It wasn’t painful, it was deep and wide. When the final nurse at Exeter doing the redressing told me to peel off any scabs I think that was wrong as those areas have left deeper scars than other parts. I also am amazed to see how much smaller the wound went from the size of half an apple when I first saw it to that of a £2 coin. The skin graft was probably the most painful, like a carpet burn, which bled quite a lot, but it healed quick enough. The scar from the lymph node removal pulled as it was glued with internal stitches. All scars eventually healed well but I think the staff at Exeter could have explained more what to expect.  
I think the nurses at Barnstaple are amazing and patiently inspect every little freckle I find. They have answered any of my questions over the phone inviting me in to see them with anything I want checked. I can’t fault the care I have been given, especially when you hear on the news of patients with other needs, especially gynaecology, are still waiting.  
[Unsure about 'Manager']  
  
[Unsure about 'Doctor']

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Chloe-Nicole B
title: Kind and compassionate urgent care
body:
I attended Urgent Care/Zone B in mid April 2022. I was referred there by my GP that morning. Dr McMullan got in contact with me almost immediately to invite me up at my nearest possible convenience. When I arrived, he called me immediately and welcomed me to the department. He listened to me so well and kept me informed continuously, taking my feelings/opinions seriously and helping me feel validated.  
He was quick to arrange scans for me. I was cannulated with bloods taken, consultation, CT and ophthalmology scan within 1 hour and 15 minutes of arriving. He is kind, compassionate and very reassuring. I have a rare Connective Tissue Disorder and am no stranger to hospitals, meaning sometimes it’s easy to be overwhelmed or feeling a little deflated on days like these.  
Nobody starts their day with the intention of needing to go to Urgent Care, so I was feeling a little flustered when I learnt I needed to go up but Dr McMullan has taken amazing care of me from the second I arrived and really went out of his way for me during my entire time here. I am incredibly grateful to have such great services like this and Dr McMullan has really made a difference and I will be forever grateful for his help.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Virtual visiting is wonderful
body:
My stay in Craigavon hospital has been a very positive experience. I am thankful for everything the nurses and other staff are doing for me, whilst recovering.  
I have been using the virtual visiting service, it’s great the way my family can organise calls with me. Whenever I see the girl with the iPad come in I get so excited to see my children’s faces.  
I think this is such a wonderful and thoughtful thing that this hospital has in place.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great optometrist
body: The optometrist is very professional and attentive to kids. Definitely recommend this practice to others

title: Briliant services
body: From start to end, they were very professional and helpful . I recommend it.  The key words: they were fast and pro

title: Fantastic staff
body: Attended for gastroscopy, very very scared and anxious, nurse who greeted me so reassuring, I requested sedation no throat spray, she explained everything, she put cannula in, didn't even hurt at all, went into room for the procedure, greeted by nurse again lovely, endoscopist wonderful, all staff so caring, had sedation don't remember a thing, came round felt fine, called my daughter in explained results, gave me a copy to take home, it was like magic and I really mean that, I would say to anyone having this done at this hospital, trust the staff they are absolute superstars, cannot thank them enough, they took away all my anxiety and made a daunting procedure nothing to worry about, thanks to every single one of them

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Professional and understanding
body: The staff were extremely professional and understanding of all patients. I felt like I was treated fairly and was cared for during my stay. A special mention for the staff nurse working on the admissions lounge in the Lincoln wing for handling a fair few stressful situations while keeping her composure and professionalism, a pleasure to be around. Other than that, all staff were excellent especially on the admissions lounge, Lincoln wing as well as at various other places in the hospital which I visited during my stay. Thank you all very much for your help, know that you are appreciated greatly.

title: Amazing care
body: Sent to A and E  from my GP at mid day Monday.  Unfortunately the dept was really busy and understaffed due to covid, but the care I received was excellent.  Despite having to wait 15 hours before I got a hospital bed, they were so busy, I really felt for them.  They were working their best under extreme pressure.  Once on the ward all the staff were friendly, helpful and informative from the domestic staff to the consultants.  I received every test possible to find my diagnosis.  The only issue I had was lack of sleep due to being on a ward with very ill elderly patients who were noisy all night, either calling out  coughing or snoring.  They slept all day, so tended to be unsettled all night.  I left hospital exhausted and was so pleased to return home to finally get some sleep.  I appreciate this situation is probably unavoidable.  Thank you to all the staff at Bedford hospital.  Also to the lovely young lady who helped me when I collapsed in A and E, who herself was very poorly and had been waiting for several hours herself.  Wish I had caught her name to say thank you personally.

title: Treated with respect and appropriate humour
body: I found the treatment which I received today was exemplary right from the first instance of the person meeting me outside reception to the ever so bubbly receptionists and then onto the very professional but approachable A&E and Minor Injuries teams. Whilst my treatment from start to finish took over 7 hours the care and respect which I was given made this worthwhile. I cannot praise the whole hospital staff highly enough.

title: Exemplary Service
body: I needed to visit A&E following a bad cut to my leg. The treatment I received from reception, through triage to the doctor and nurses that treated me was outstanding. Everyone went out of their way to make sure I was OK and understood the next procedure. I just want to say a big THANK YOU to the whole team - Well done NHS.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent hospital + Staff
body: I went in for an operation and from the initial assessment, pre-op , operation and after care, the professionalism , expertise and kindness from all staff levels was second to none.

title: Excellent support in challenging circumstances
body:
Admission to A&E was a real eye opener. Coming from a medical background with a daughter who is an A&E Medicine Consultant, I thought I knew what the challenges the staff had to deal with were. Seeing and experiencing A&E in operation demonstrated how wrong I was! 
The professionalism of all the staff (medical, nursing and support) was impressive and I was amazed at how well they coped with the challenges they faced.
I was extremely grateful to have been so well looked after.
Thank you to everyone.

title: Unhelpful reception team.
body: The reception team absolutely unhelpful. The  It is almost impossible to contact the GP centre for an appointment in a timely fashion. Pathetic service. I left the practice in tears after suffering from so much pain and not being able to book an appointment and had to contact 111

title: Two tier maternity department
body: I was not able to give birth in the MLU (midwife led unit) due to being classed as high risk. However, I have seen pictures of it and several of my friends have given birth there and it looks amazing, well done Leighton for that. However, for women such as me, who need to give birth on the labour ward the rooms couldn't be more different. They are sterile and medical looking and quite frankly scary. No beautiful pictures on the walls, no ambient lighting, music and soft furnishings like the MLU rooms have. To me this feels like a two tier system of maternity care, making the high risk women second class citizens compared to those who are able to use the MLU. Why did no one think that we would also appreciate some of the beautiful surroundings in our birth space which seems set up purely for the benefit of the staff working there rather than the women for whom the service is designed. Very disappointing that our needs were not thought about when designing those rooms.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: JBathie
title: Helpful video consultation with diabetes specialist nurse
body:
I had a video call. This was successful and I now know how to change my insulin dosage with some confidence. I also know how to inject using the upper part of my thigh whilst sitting down.  
Thank you Lynn for all your help and advice.

author: phoenixjb74
title: My stay in Loane House
body:
I arrived in Loane House on a Tuesday evening. I was made feel very welcome from the start, and got great treatment and care from all the staff from Wendy the ward sister, doctors, nurses, auxiliaries, physios and OTs. The companion on the ward was very attentive to me and encouraged me to chat to her and I made an Easter Bonnet with her help.  
Sean Paul the nurse was exceptionally good to me, everyone was!  
I am now getting home today and going to miss everyone. A special word to all the patients in my Bay. A Big thank you to everyone who took part in my care. I wont forget you!

author: RickyL
title: Recovering from a stroke
body:
I suffered a stroke in March 2022. I was admitted to Green Square, then transferred to Royal Free. The stroke affected the right side of my body.  
Obviously, I was very scared and concerned for my future. From my past experiences with some of my family members and friends, I realised that my golden period of recovery is the first three months from the stroke. So I made a conscious decision that I need to get better no matter how little.  
With the help my therapists at Royal Free, Matt and Laura, I started to regain some of my mobilities. A big thanks to them for the skilful treatments, patient and constant encouragements. Of course, my gratitude to all the medical team there.  
In early April, I was transferred to NRC in Edgware. It was a more relaxed environment. I regained more mobilities as days go by. The team of therapists were wonderful, especially Selma. I could not thank her enough.  
At first they told me that I may have to stay here for up to six weeks, but after 10 days, I was ready to return home to continue my recovery journey. I returned home in mid-April.  
The only complaint I have was the food, it could be better.  
Thank you all very much for being there for me and keep up for your great works. You always have my support.

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you for my acute care at home
body:
Story by 70-79 year old female patient from Strabane area.  
This team was amazing. The care I received was second to none.  
I was very happy with each and everyone of the team. They were so friendly, they explained everything in detail, and arrived on time everyday. I am so thankful to have been referred to this service.  
Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Talented and hardworking staff
body:
I am currently recovering from surgery that I recently received.  
The surgery went as planned and I couldn’t thank all the staff down at the theatres enough. They are all very hardworking and talented people, who deserve a pat on the back.  
I feel very relaxed and comfortable on this ward, the beds are great. I am able to lie up and rest most of the day whilst the nurses and care assistants take care of me.  
The ward is always tidy and the food offered is okay, I am not too fussed on the lunch and dinner meals. Although I do really enjoy and look forward to getting my breakfast, as it seems fresher and just like my breakfast at home.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matt-W
title: Thank you for my day surgery
body:
I would like to thank Mr James, Sharon Susan Melissa and Elspith for my care today.  
Mr James as always make you feel you are the most important person in hospital that day. All the nurses make you feel a lot better for having met them. Exemplary as always 👍  
Thank you all.

author: PAtk28
title: Amazing staff for son's day surgery
body:
My son attended day surgery at RHC ward 1A for elective surgery.  
The staff were absolutely amazing. They were so caring, explained everything to my son in simple language and put us both at ease! From nurses, HCA, surgeon, theatre staff and anaesthetist, the care was excellent.  
Very happy with our experience on Monday!  
Little area for improvement in terms of check in. There’s no signage explaining patients are to wait until called into the ward. There were a lot of people waiting at 7.30am including us and no one was clear about the check in process. Minor point but very important for anxious parents ☺️

author: ospreybw98
title: Efficient, professional whilst being personal
body:
I felt comfortable and appreciated. It was a nice environment with great staff. The nurse was efficient and professional.  
I understand that there still needs to be some distance but would be great to be able to get more appointments and more people in through the door.

title: A very positive maternity experience
body:
We had a very positive experience while having our daughter last month. The staff in labour ward, theatre and maternity were all amazing. We can't thank our midwife Joice, Dr Pak and anaesthetist Ella enough. They made my husband and I feel as relaxed as possible throughout.  
All the staff in Ward 16 including the student midwives were so attentive making our stay a very positive one.  
We will be forever grateful to all BGH maternity & theatre staff. Thank you all!

title: Not fit for purpose
body: Rang 111 at 1pm as 1 year old has a temp, diarrhoea, refusing food and drink. NHS website stated this is a 111 call. Was told someone would ring me back within the hour to arrange an appointment. 8:30pm still no call back. He is not sick enough for a and e but as a 1 year old cannot tell me what is wrong and I am not medically trained. I understand they might be busy but from other reviews this is common, therefore the system needs changing.

title: I can not get a appointment
body: I've been at this practice for over 20 years, and I'm sorry to say, its gone down hill. I haven't seen a doctor for nearly three years. I have a long term condition, yet I am unable to get a face to face appointment. Twice I had to pay for a private doctor for my eczema and my lump on my neck, because they offered face to face appointment. This is outrageous, why can't I get get a face to face appointment? Telephone appointment can not diagnose acute eczema nor examine the lump on my neck. Please improve

title: A 'crisis' team that doesn't answer the phone.
body: My brother suffers from psychosis, he got sectioned last year and has become unwell again after the hospital have given him false hope regarding 'getting better' and being off meds within a year,  even though schizophrenia runs in our family, which they have never taken that into consideration. Anyway, my brother came off his meds as he believes he doesn't need them, only to fall unwell again... he has locked himself in his flat, won't speak to his family and becomes aggressive when anyone questions his reality... my dad rang this crisis team after he was physically assaulted by my brother, four hours he rang and not one person answered the phone! The only help he managed to get was from a local doctor's surgery, thankfully the GP who answered clearly had a conscience. Our experience with York mental health throughout my brothers journey into psychosis has been absolutely shocking, it baffles me how someone can be sectioned and no team is set up to support them after he is released from hospital? No checking up on him, no psychiatry, absolutely nothing was done to support his release. I could go honestly go on about how poor and little help they've been but, it's a waste of breathe.. we are at a loss and have been let down by the system over and over again... i honestly can say I have absolutely no faith in them anymore. Appaling.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: What once was great has been let down
body: Had a fantastic experience when I came here to give birth. However, 6 months later with a severely sick infant only one parent is allowed in the hospital at one time, with no opportunity to ‘swap’. Me and my partner had to make the excruciating decision of who would stay with our sick baby and who would wait in the car park. Parliament has lifted all other Covid restrictions so why does the hospital decide to still enforce them? The family unit is vital in a time of crisis like a sick baby.

title: Big enough to make a difference, small enough to…
body:
This practice has doctors and a team that are always there for you. They go the extra mile in ensuring you are listened to, understood and treated with care and compassion.
Personally over the last 10 years they have supported me through treatment at Christie’s, a suspected stroke, and other issues.
Even when I registered a positive Covid test on the NHS app - the following day I received a call to ensure I had everything I need.
Moving with the times, prescriptions are forwarded to the local pharmacy electronically and you can access you medical records and request repeat prescriptions, make appointments and see other valuable information on line.
Yes they do have busy times. You may not be seen or receive a call at an agreed time, but that just shows the attention the doctors give to patients. What is more important is that they will get to you.
So for me and my family this is an outstanding practice which provides a most valuable service. They are truly big enough to make a difference and small enough to care.

title: Too difficult to get appointments either by phone…
body: It is with extreme regret that I am posting this review as I appreciate how hard it has been and still is for the GP surgeries. Unfortunately I have to concur with the negative comments on the appointments system. It is so difficult if not impossible to contact the surgery by phone as it is constantly busy and/or there are extremely long waiting times. This would be okay but when you do get through there are no appointments left and you are told to call the next day after 8 p.m. and so it continues. It is fine calling later in the day but if you need an appointment you have to call as soon as possible after 8 a.m. to try and get an appointment. This is even the case if you have to see a doctor to receive test results which is worrying as understandably you want these asap especially if you might need medication or a referral - I found myself in this situation a few months ago.  The on line system is just as bad, especially if you are a bit slow like me, as by their own admission you have to log on asap after 8 a.m. when they press 'go' on the allocation of appointments for that day. The appointments that are left after this booking race which is what it feels like (if there are any) are weeks ahead. I have no problem with a phone call rather than f2f but these are not available either.  If there is a problem such as not being able to get a repeat prescription or any other pressing issue even when it isn't your fault you are expected to make an appointment to sort it out which in view of the above is very stressful especially when it can take so much time and effort and it is weeks ahead. This has made me feel very down when it happens as I am worried about the consequences on my health. I This doesn't happen that often thankfully and these things happen but there is a need to sort out any issues in the most timely and effective way.  I know the NHS and GP surgeries in particular are under extreme pressure but I can't help thinking that this approach is causing them more work in the long run.  I know there has to be a way of dealing with the high demands on the service but I do not know how someone who is very elderly or has a disability copes at all. I have raised this with the surgery in the past but was told that most people go on line and is is fine.  In summary I think the doctors, nurses etc. are very good but the system for booking and contacting them is poor and I am not sure if they realise that some of their patients are suffering these difficulties.

title: Extremely unsupportive
body:
My partner and I came to bath hospital to receive help with my partners pregnancy as she was experiencing complications at just 5 weeks, upon many hours of waiting and different tests they told us that she had a miscarriage. They also told us that she had a “UTI” which they seemed to worry about more than the miscarriage. After 8 long excruciating hours all we left with was some antibiotics for the UTI and my partner and I received no sort of support or been referred to any sort of service to do with a miscarriage, This left us heartbroken and extremely upset as this is our first pregnancy and to receive no help or guidance at all is unremarkably appalling, Furthermore the staff seemed less interested in the fact that my partner has had a miscarriage and deemed the UTI more fitting to worry about. 

Although we may be young. We were extremely excited to be able to raise and love our own child.

On a further note. We also noticed that there was dry, old blood in the sink and on the bin of the male restrooms. 

We hope this review gets to the right people to see that our experience has completely destroyed us emotionally and hopefully they fix these issues in the future so no other future parents have to deal with the pain we feel.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Car parking beware
body: I went for a eye appointment and parked in the carpark underneath Barbara castle health center, I put my registration in the machine and it came back saying no fee payable. I was 31 minutes and have now received a parking fine. If the machine had said there was a fee to pay when I put my registration in I would have paid. Beware as there is something clearly wrong, not impressed at all.

title: Bad care
body: I am in hospital 24 weeks pregnant and suspected kidney stones in absolute agony everytime passing urine hanging onto curtain rail shaking all over worse pain of my life and nurses take 30 mins to get to me after ringing buzzer and asking for pain relief whilst I'm rolling round in bed then doctors come and say that I can go home with pain relief are they serious ho home ill be swinging of the lamp shade in pain if it wasn't for me yesterday they would of overdosed me I told them I'd already had pain relief and they was going to give me double dose because the computer was down not good
